{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3545502,"name":"Waz","username":"Waz","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/w/7cd45c/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-03T03:31:23.081Z","cooked":"

I was taking a look at the WPIlib Intermediate Vision example in Python (examples/IntermediateVision at main · robotpy/examples · GitHub) and wanted to try it out.

I have not been able to resolve the import for OpenCV. It appears to be present in the WPIlib Artifactory server (JFrog).

I have tried several different entries in the pyproject.toml file but the sync command always fails. In both the robotpy_extras and the requires sections, I have tried both “opencv”, “robotpy-opencv”. I think the proper one should be “robotpy-opencv” in the requires section but I see this error in the pip window.

ERROR: Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement robotpy-opencv (from versions: none)
ERROR: No matching distribution found for robotpy-opencv

I tried a couple of version specifications based on what I see in Artifactory, but to no avail. I am rather new to python dependency resolution and may be missing something obvious. Has anyone gotten this to work?

Add ‘cscore’ to robotpy_extras and it will download the appropriate packages during sync and install them at deploy.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-03-03T03:54:14.825Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":44,"readers_count":43,"score":13.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":493942,"topic_slug":"importing-opencv","display_username":"Dustin Spicuzza","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":11063,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"RobotPy Guy, WPILib Developer"},"post_url":"/t/importing-opencv/493942/2","custom_user_title":"RobotPy Guy, WPILib Developer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3545587,"name":"Waz","username":"Waz","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/w/7cd45c/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-03T05:48:56.254Z","cooked":"

I probably should have mentioned it, but I had added cscore to robotpy_extras. That made the

from cscore import CameraServer as CS

resolve properly, but

import cv2

was still not resolving.

That was when I tried the steps I described in the the original post. I ran sync again with just cscore and searched the output for opencv and it appears that robotpy-opencv and its dependencies have been downloaded. However, the import cv2 still does not resolve. The error in VSCode is

Import "cv2" could not be resolved

Could the import in the example be incorrect? Should it be something other than cv2?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-03-03T05:48:56.254Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":35,"readers_count":34,"score":17.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":493942,"topic_slug":"importing-opencv","display_username":"Waz","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":11063,"username":"virtuald","name":"Dustin Spicuzza","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/virtuald/{size}/65268_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20488,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/importing-opencv/493942/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3545605,"name":"Dustin Spicuzza","username":"virtuald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/virtuald/{size}/65268_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-03T06:33:31.150Z","cooked":"

robotpy-opencv is only available on the RoboRIO, so import cv2 will only work on your robot. If that is installed and does not work, that is a bug that we should fix.

If you want the cv2 library to be available locally, you need to install opencv-python, or if you’re on linux you can install an opencv python package from your distribution.

cscore doesn’t cause opencv to be installed except on the rio because there’s a lot of different ways one might install opencv, and doing it in a particular way might break a system if a user didn’t expect it. We should probably have better documentation in the examples explaining this.

Thank you for explaining it. The next time I get access to the robot (I am not sure where this will fall in our work prioritization getting ready for competition this weekend), I will try it out.
